summary: An integrated circuit (IC), or microchip, is a tiny electronic device with multiple components like transistors and resistors, all connected on a silicon base. These circuits power our daily devices like computers and phones. ICs are smaller, faster, and cheaper than traditional discrete components, leading to their widespread use. They're mass-produced, reliable, and can pack billions of transistors into a small space, following Moore's law. ICs offer advantages in size, cost, and performance but require significant initial investment for design and factory construction.
title: Integrated circuit
